results.definition: move downward and lower, but not necessarily all the way
examples: The barometer is falling

results.definition: the act of surrendering (usually under agreed conditions)
come into the possession of
when a wrestler's shoulders are forced to the mat
fall from clouds
examples: rain, snow and sleet were falling

results.definition: lose an upright position suddenly
a sudden decline in strength or number or importance
examples: the fall of the House of Hapsburg

results.definition: fall or flow in a certain way
fall to somebody by assignment or lot
a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
examples: when that became known the price of their stock went into free fall

results.definition: a free and rapid descent by the force of gravity
touch or seem as if touching visually or audibly
decrease in size, extent, or range
come as if by falling
a downward slope or bend
the season when the leaves fall from the trees
examples: in the fall of 1973

results.definition: the time of day immediately following sunset
examples: they finished before the fall of night

results.definition: a sudden drop from an upright position
come under, be classified or included
examples: fall into a category

results.definition: be inherited by
a lapse into sin; a loss of innocence or of chastity
examples: a fall from virtue

results.definition: a movement downward
examples: the rise and fall of the tides

results.definition: assume a disappointed or sad expression
be born, used chiefly of lambs
be captured
be cast down
be due
examples: payments fall on the 1st of the month

results.definition: begin vigorously
come out; issue
descend in free fall under the influence of gravity
die, as in battle or in a hunt
examples: Several deer have fallen to the same gun

results.definition: drop oneself to a lower or less erect position
go as if by falling
lose office or power
lose one's chastity
examples: a fallen woman

results.definition: move in a specified direction
examples: The line of men fall forward

results.definition: occur at a specified time or place
examples: Christmas falls on a Monday this year
The accent falls on the first syllable

results.definition: pass suddenly and passively into a state of body or mind
examples: fall into a trap
fall asleep
fall prey to an imposter
fall into a strange way of thinking

results.definition: slope downward
examples: The hills around here fall towards the ocean

results.definition: suffer defeat, failure, or ruin
examples: We must stand or fall
fall by the wayside

results.definition: the lapse of mankind into sinfulness because of the sin of Adam and Eve
to be given by assignment or distribution
to be given by right or inheritance
yield to temptation or sin
